intro: Diplazium sorzogonense, commonly known as the Philippine water fern, is a species of fern native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Diplazium sorzogonense plays an important role in the ecological balance of its native habitat.
